thread.title: Motel room police raid yields 2 arrests, meth, guns, body armor
thread.title_full: Motel room police raid yields 2 arrests, meth, guns, body armor | OregonLive.com

author: Everton Bailey Jr. | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Motel room police raid yields 2 arrests, meth, guns, body armor
text:
A police raid of a Portland motel room led to two people being arrested, and the seizure of more than five pounds of methamphetamine, guns, cash and body armor on Wednesday, authorities say.
Cesar Medina Serna, 49, and Joel Correa Reyes, 45, were booked into the Multnomah County Detention Center on suspicion of possession and delivery of a controlled substance. Serna also faces accusations of manufacture of a controlled substance, felon in possession of a firearm, unlawful possession of a firearm and first-degree theft.
The search of the room at the Deluxe Inn Motel at 6846 S.E. Powell Blvd. , was part of a meth trafficking investigation, according to the Multnomah County Sheriff's Office. Along with the drugs, investigators found five firearms, $2,180 cash and body armor.
The meth found has an estimated value of $380,000, the sheriff's office said.
-- Everton Bailey Jr.
